means: 金字塔( pyramid的名词复数 )
金字塔形的物体（或一堆东西）
金字塔式的组织（或系统）

sentence.Network_en: We set off to see the Pyramids and Sphinx.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们出发去看金字塔和狮身人面像。

sentence.Network_en: He also studied the ancient stone tablets from around the pyramids.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还研究了在金字塔周围发现的古代石匾。

sentence.Network_en: One of the seven wonders of the ancient world was the Pyramids.
sentence.Network_cn: 金字塔是古代世界的七大奇迹之一.

PerfectNetExp.abs: the pyramids are known to the world ., 埃及金字塔闻名于世界.
the Egyptian pyramids developed from the mastaba .埃及金字塔是从古埃及墓室发展而来的。
The pharaohs were entombed in the pyramids ., 法老被埋葬在金字塔中.

pyramids solve what Yoshisuke Aikawa , the founder of the Nissan group in pre-war Japan , once called the " capitalist's quandary " : how to money from outsiders without ceding control .这些金字塔解答了一度被称为“资本家的困惑”：怎样从没有放弃控制的外人身上赚钱。

entry.def: Pyramids are ancient stone buildings with four triangular sloping sides. The most famous pyramids are those built in ancient Egypt to contain the bodies of their kings and queens.

example.ex: We set off to see the Pyramids and Sphinx.
example.tran: 我们出发去看金字塔和狮身人面像。

entry.def: A pyramid is a shape, object, or pile of things with a flat base and sloping triangular sides that meet at a point.

example.ex: On a plate in front of him was piled a pyramid of flat white biscuits.
example.tran: 在他面前的盘子上有一摞摆成金字塔形状的白色薄饼。

entry.tran: 金字塔式结构（或组织、体系）
entry.def: You can describe something as a pyramid when it is organized so that there are fewer people at each level as you go towards the top.

example.ex: Traditionally, the Brahmins, or the priestly class, are set at the top of the social pyramid.
example.tran: 传统上，婆罗门，或称僧侣阶级，处于社会金字塔的顶端。
